channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Steven Spielberg’s production company signs multifilm deal with Netflix
item.description: Not long ago, Spielberg was trying to disqualify Netflix films from the Oscars.

item.title: Amazon Prime Day 2021: All the deals that are actually worth your time [Updated]
item.description: Now updated with a “$50 for $40” gift card deal, OLED TV discounts, and more.

item.title: The ISRG wants to make the Linux kernel memory-safe with Rust
item.description: The simplest way to avoid C-language coding traps is to avoid coding in C.

item.title: Connecting to malicious Wi-Fi networks can mess with your iPhone
item.description: The world’s most secure consumer OS is bitten by a garden-variety programming bug.

item.title: Texans regret opting into power plan that remotely raises thermostat temps
item.description: Some Texans who opted into energy-saving plan didn’t realize what they agreed to.

item.title: CentOS replacement distro Rocky Linux’s first general release is out
item.description: CentOS co-founder Greg Kurtzer’s new distro hit general availability today.

item.title: We pee or flush drugs into waterways—does that matter to aquatic life?
item.description: Many of the drugs we flush could change aquatic animal behavior—theoretically.

item.title: Even creepier COVID tracking: Google silently pushed app to users’ phones [Updated]
item.description: Massachusetts launched a COVID tracking app, and uh, it was automatically installed?!

item.title: Planes, trains, but not automobiles—why GM is developing fuel cells
item.description: We talk to GM about its hydrogen fuel cell strategy.

item.title: A range of good Garmin smartwatches and Fitbits on sale for Prime Day
item.description: Some of our top smartwatch picks are at their lowest prices yet for Prime Day.

item.title: Sony relists Cyberpunk 2077, includes new warning: Base PS4 “not recommended”
item.description: Version 1.23 approaches 30 fps on base PS4—but still isn’t quite enough for PSN.

item.title: “Black fungus” surges in India—thousands blinded, maimed, dead
item.description: Experts hypothesize that a combination of factors linked to COVID is fueling the surge.

item.title: The Ariane 6 debut is slipping again as Europe hopes for a late 2022 launch
item.description: “This is a huge challenge that we need to work together on.”

item.title: The best Prime Day 2021 tech deals from everywhere besides Amazon
item.description: A few good deals for those not wishing to give business to Amazon on Prime Day.

item.title: The best Amazon Prime Day 2021 deals under $50 we can find
item.description: We’ve cut through the noise to find Prime Day’s best buys for bargain hunters.

item.title: Sony’s excellent WH-1000XM4 headphones are down to a new low for Prime Day
item.description: One of our favorite sets of true wireless earbuds is deeply discounted as well.

item.title: Porsche will build a high-performance battery factory in Germany
item.description: The joint venture with Customcells will focus on cells with silicon anodes.

item.title: Hitman’s Wife’s Bodyguard is the raunchy action/comedy we need right now
item.description: Ryan Reynolds, Samuel L. Jackson, and Salma Hayek carry film through the rough spots.

item.title: Sweet Tooth review: Evidently The Walking Dead just needed a deerboy
item.description: It’s light(ish) but includes masks, disease-driven death, and humans being bad to each other.

item.title: Test out next-gen space tech in Kerbal Space Program
item.description: The rocket-building game lets you pilot a fusion-propelled craft right now.

item.title: Archaeologists recreated three common kinds of Paleolithic cave lighting
item.description: Experiments could enhance our understanding of the origin of prehistoric art in caves.

item.title: Two Viking burials, separated by an ocean, contain close kin
item.description: Two Viking Age warriors from the same family died hundreds of kilometers apart.

item.title: The efforts to make text-based AI less racist and terrible
item.description: Researchers try different approaches to solve problem of amplifying negative stereotypes.

item.title: Pornhub sued for allegedly serving “under-age, non-consensual” videos
item.description: “I seek justice for myself and the countless victims who don’t come forward.”

item.title: Ring gave cops free cameras to build and promote surveillance network
item.description: LAPD officers “spread the word” for the startup, helping it gain market share.

item.title: Arcade1Up pinball cabinet review: Fine for families, interesting for modders
item.description: The default package is worth its $600 cost, but do your research before buying.

item.title: Apple and Google’s AI wizardry promises privacy—at a cost
item.description: Upgraded data protection and less reliance on the cloud could lock users in.

item.title: Rocket Report: China launches crew mission, SpaceX runs into road troubles
item.description: “The Space Safari team intends to push the envelope.”

item.title: Ukraine arrests ransomware gang in global cybercriminal crackdown
item.description: Arrests of Cl0p hacker group members adds to pressure on other countries to follow suit.

item.title: Game Boy Advance game gets split-screen multiplayer through new FPGA core
item.description: No link-cable needed for this emulated single-machine, single-display solution.

item.title: Newly discovered Vigilante malware outs software pirates and blocks them
item.description: Most malware tries to steal stuff. Vigilante, by contrast, takes aim at piracy.

item.title: Amazon joins Apple, Google by reducing its app store cut
item.description: Developers with revenues under $1 million are getting a new deal.

item.title: A number of recommended Nintendo Switch games are on sale today
item.description: Dealmaster also has early Prime Day discounts, Philips Hue deals, and more.

item.title: Microsoft’s Linux repositories were down for 18+ hours
item.description: The outage prevented Linux installation or upgrade of any Microsoft software.

item.title: FDA officials asked to step down after contentious Alzheimer’s drug approval
item.description: Three experts resigned in protest. Watchdog says it’s FDA brass that should leave.

item.title: Researchers cool a 40 kg object to near its quantum ground state
item.description: Mirrors of the LIGO gravitational-wave detector get cool—extremely cool.

item.title: Here’s what’s inside Google’s first-ever retail store
item.description: Buy a speaker, try Google Stadia, or fix a cracked phone screen—the store is open.

item.title: Peter Jackson’s 6-hour Beatles documentary confirmed for Disney+ this November
item.description: Jackson thanks Beatles, Disney for “allowing me to present this story” as 6-hour beast.

item.title: Bethesda exec says he’s “sorry” for lack of PS5 Starfield
item.description: “I’m certain that’s frustrating… but there’s not a whole lot I can do about it.”

item.title: World Bank slams bitcoin, declines to help El Salvador’s cryptocurrency plan
item.description: Bank faults bitcoin’s “environmental and transparency shortcomings.”

item.title: Lordstown Motors now says that it has no binding orders for EV truck
item.description: It clarified with the Securities and Exchange Commission that it has no firm orders.

item.title: SpaceX to break the final frontier in reuse with national defense launch
item.description: Thursday’s GPS mission is a high priority for the Space Force.

item.title: Ohio Republicans close to imposing near-total ban on municipal broadband
item.description: Bill’s 10Mbps standard could make 98% of Ohio ineligible for municipal networks.

item.title: A new HTTP spec proposes elimination of obnoxious “cookie banners”
item.description: Explicit privacy communication mechanism can simplify UI and limit user fatigue.
